description:
Do you want to make a meaningful difference in the quality of healthcare? Omnicell is empowering health systems and pharmacies to radically transform the way they manage medications, so they can achieve the vision of the Autonomous Pharmacy.  Thousands of hospitals, pharmacies, skilled nursing facilities and care homes trust Omnicell to provide continuous innovation.  They need us to deliver solutions to meet the ever-evolving challenges of the healthcare landscape.  We encourage creative problem solving and outside-the-box thinking that only a diverse, well-rounded workforce can bring.

Join us as we build on our powerful combination of advanced automation, predictive intelligence, and expert services to create a safer future for patients-one where medication errors are a thing of the past. You'll be joining an organization whose culture encourages individual development, rewards intellectual curiosity, and embraces an inclusive environment.  Join our growing company and help shape the future at Omnicell!

Software Engineering Intern

Would you like to be part of a company that is a technology pioneer in the healthcare industry?  Would you like to engineer systems that have a significant impact on patient care, healthcare spends and population health management? Do you want to be part of an organization in the continued development of a cloud and microservices architecture?  And do you want to learn what it is to work in an agile environment that values sustainable quality over velocity and encourage team members' direct participation? If you answered yes to any of these questions, Omnicell is looking for you.

Omnicell's customers range from clinicians in large hospitals to managing their own medication regiment from home.  Our mission to improve healthcare for everyone.  We do this by removing unnecessary manual processes that allow caregivers to focus on what matters; the patient.  We also help patients who are talking medications succeed in being adherent to their medication regimen, keeping them healthier and reducing their overall healthcare spend. To learn more, take a look at our Vision for the Autonomous Pharmacy.

Omnicell is looking for exceptional talent with great ideas, skills and passion for technology and healthcare. As an intern for the Internet of Things engineering team, you will be an active participant and contributor, helping us transform healthcare.

Things you'll do during your internship:

  • Work with an Assigned Mentor and Agile Team to understand requirements, implement creative system solutions, and verify the results through automated test cases for Point of Care solutions.

  • At the end of your internship you will present your project to Omnicell product development leadership.

  • Will be working with team of devs and testers to help and understand the code.

  • Will be responsible to work on a workflow and deep dive in the code to understand and get all possible details of the behavior of the feature or workflow

Every day, Global Payments makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best-in-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our dynamic team and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.

Netspend/Global Payments is so excited to offer an internship opportunity for Summer 2021! We are looking for Interns who will be assisting with the design and development of proprietary software in a highly secure and a heavy transaction-based environment. The demands of the internship will require the knowledge, skills, and abilities of students currently enrolled in a four year Bachelors or Masters program, preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.This exciting opportunity will require students who can dive into a developer role and who have a desire to learn to deliver scalable and robust business applications. Interns will assist in the design and development of new functionality as well as consistently producing on-going scheduled maintenance releases and bug-fixes. Interns will also be exposed to business functions outside of the software group, including Customer Service, Finance, and Compliance processes.Responsibilities:
  • NOTE: Interns will be paired with mentors for the duration of this internship
  • Create and enhance enterprise applications from design to implementation based on high-level business requirements
  • Deliver scalable and reliable software
  • Deliver solutions, prioritize activities, and manage time effectively
  • Handle ambiguous or undefined technical challenges with strong problem solving abilities
  • Work and collaborate efficiently in a virtual team setting
Required:
  • Must be currently enrolled in a four year Bachelors or Masters program, preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science or Computer Engineering
  • Proven grade point average of 3.0 or above and are on-track to graduate within 24 months
  • Able to work 35 - 40 hours a week
  • Strong object-oriented programming ability including knowledge of design patterns
  • Understanding of databases and data modeling
  • Basic understanding of testing methodologies
  • Understanding of Unix/Linux environments
Preferred:
  • Experience developing applications using the Spring framework
  • Experience creating and using RESTful APIs
  • Desire to work on every piece of the technology stack
  • Understanding of cloud technologies including AWS and GCP
What's in it for you?:
  • A Paid Internship in an Austin, Texas based technology company!
  • An opportunity to do hands-on work in a real-world environment and deliver software solutions that benefit our customers and internal business partners
  • Real-world, challenging problems that you are able to solve through technology solutions
  • A supportive, professional environment where you can learn and grow
  • An opportunity for visibility to leadership and exposure to a highly-skilled technical staff

Global Payments Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

Global Payments provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by law. Those applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application and/or interview process should notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.

ChannelAdvisor’s platform enables large retailers to manage global ecommerce operations across online marketplaces, webstores, and digital marketing sites.  We are partners with the biggest names in the ecommerce industry such as Amazon, eBay, Google, and Alibaba. Last year, our systems processed over $5.7 billion in online sales.

 

 

You will get experience with many of these technologies.  Experience with any of them is a plus.

  • Relational databases such as Microsoft SQL Server
  • NoSQL technologies like Redis
  • Microsoft Visual Studio and the .NET platform
  • Cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure
  • Version control systems like git

As an engineering intern at ChannelAdvisor, you will become a member of our development team and have the following opportunities:

  • Work closely with leaders in the ecommerce industry, including Amazon, eBay, Google, Alibaba, and more
  • Participate in a fast-paced agile development team building software as a service (SaaS) applications with potential to grow into a full-time developer position
  • Collaborate among a small, 5-8 person team with ownership of a core component of the ChannelAdvisor platform

  • University student pursuing Bachelor’s degree or above
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • An enthusiasm for building software
  • Currently enrolled in a Computer Science or a closely-related program, current senior or rising senior
  • Experience writing software using C# or Java
  • Ability to work independently with limited supervisionMinimum of 20 hours per week
  • Ability to work in a virtual environment



Capstone:

At the closure of the internship, the intern will present to their manager and other members of the EMT/Leadership Team.

 

Internship Program:

Our internship provides experience to students of diverse backgrounds. Students will gain meaningful work experience and have the opportunity to participate in the following activities: 

  • Complete an 8-week Project(s)
  • Resume and LinkedIn Workshop
  • Mock Interviews
  • Meet & Greet with EMT
  • Capstone Presentation

Overview

ChannelAdvisor's platform enables large retailers to manage global ecommerce operations across online marketplaces, webstores, and digital marketing sites.  We are partners with the biggest names in the ecommerce industry such as Amazon, eBay, Google, and Alibaba. Last year, our systems processed over 5.7 billion in online sales.

 

 

You will get experience with many of these technologies.  Experience with any of them is a plus.

  • Relational databases such as Microsoft SQL Server
  • NoSQL technologies like Redis
  • Microsoft Visual Studio and the .NET platform
  • Cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure
  • Version control systems like Subversion

As an engineering intern at ChannelAdvisor, you will become a member of our development team and have the following opportunities:

  • Work closely with leaders in the ecommerce industry, including Amazon, eBay, Google, Alibaba, and more
  • Participate in a fast-paced agile development team building software as a service (SaaS) applications with potential to grow into a full-time developer position
  • Collaborate among a small, 5-8 person team with ownership of a core component of the ChannelAdvisor platform

Connect with us to share your profile with our recruiting team and to receive notifications about open positions. Click here to get started.

About the Position

Rev Engineers are expected to do more than just produce great code. They are expected to become experts on the problems facing our workers and customers, produce great ideas, and shape the future of our product. As an intern at Rev, you'll help us execute on our current businesses and play a role in impacting the direction of the remote labor market on a global scale. 

We are looking for exceptional full stack, iOS and Speech engineering interns to join our growth stage startup. You can expect to make an impact from day one, contributing to our web mobile, and speech apps and pushing code to production on a weekly basis. You will work alongside a group of smart, pragmatic and passionate developers.

 

Responsibilities

  • Build fully tested features for our web, mobile or speech applications
  • Drive the definition of new features and product enhancements
  • Use cutting-edge front-end technologies to build tools used by our Revvers everyday
  • Help write the next generation of our RESTful APIs
  • Design scalable systems that can keep up with our rapidly growing user base
  • Build great user experiences

 

Qualifications

  • Demonstrated software engineering experience from previous internship, work experience, coding competitions, or publications
  • Must be currently enrolled in a full-time, degree-seeking program and in the process of obtaining a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
  • Able to commit to a 10-12 week full-time (40 hrs/week) internship over the summer
  • Stellar communication, high levels of creativity, and quick problem-solving capabilities (preferred, not required)
  • An intrinsic desire to deliver and a strong sense of accountability for your work (preferred, not required)

 

Want to start your career at Rev? Please apply if you:

Full-stack web:

  • Have experience with a modern MVC framework, such as ASP .NET MVC, Ruby on Rails, Node.js
  • Enjoy building front-ends with frameworks like Bootstrap, Backbone, React.js, AngularJS

Mobile:

  • Have experience with developing mobile applications
  • Enjoy building out beautiful mobile user interfaces
  • Desire to design and develop full features from start to finish
  • Instinctively write tests in parallel with your code

Speech:

  • Have experience with scripting languages, such as Python, bash, Ruby
  • Enjoy working in the Linux environment
  • Have knowledge of Machine Learning theory

 

Life at Rev

Rev is a profitable, growth-stage startup that specializes in meeting the speech-to-text needs of hundreds of thousands of customers annually through its unmatched combination of the world's most accurate speech A.I. and the world's largest community of freelancers working side-by-side. 

Rev's suite of products includes transcription, captioning, subtitling, as well as a live-captioning app for Zoom video conferencing. Rev also boasts seamless integrations with YouTube and Vimeo, as well as custom APIs for enterprise clients who need novel speech-to-text solutions.

Founded in 2010 by five MIT alumni, Rev has raised millions of dollars in venture capital from top Silicon Valley VCs and experienced exceptionally rapid growth, both internally and externally. Rev was recently named by Forbes as one of America's Most Promising Artificial Intelligence Companies and is a destination for the world's foremost engineers and speech scientists.

Our mission is to help the world overcome the limits of the spoken word. Our vision is to transcend all barriers of communication. Joining Rev means joining a team of smart, passionate, and friendly people with different backgrounds, shared ideas, and similar goals. Oh, and tons of perks!

 

We encourage and celebrate different perspectives regardless of gender, gender identity or expression, age, race, origin, religion, caregiver status, disability, ethnicity, veteran status, or sexual orientation. Multiple points of view fuel our innovation and connect us closer to Revvers, our customers and each other.

Rev is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. Rev.com's management team is dedicated to this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities, access to facilities and programs and general treatment during employment.

*We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.

Job Details:

Job Description: 

Join a software team developing enhancing and supporting state-of-the-art database data model and infrastructure to enable process technology and process design kit automation. Collaborate with process design kit developers and process technology teams to enable highly efficient automation work flows. Responsibilities include:

  • Collaborating with team members to determine best practices and requirements for software
  • Developing intuitive software that meets and exceeds the needs of the team
  • Maintaining all software and create updates regularly to address customer and company concerns
  • Analyzing and testing programs and products before formal launch
  • Troubleshooting coding problems quickly and efficiently to ensure a productive workplace

Behavior traits we look for:

  • Outstanding collaboration and communication skills

This is an internship and compensation will be given accordingly based on candidate education level and internship duration

Qualifications:

You must possess the below requirements to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your schoolwork and/or classes and/or research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum requirements:

Pursuing a MS/PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering. 6+ months experience in the following areas:

  • On largescale software projects
  • Developing software utilizing various coding languages like Python and Ruby
  • Analyzing code for weaknesses and errors and present detailed plans to improve
  • Developing customized code for multiple projects simultaneously

Preferred:

  • Design rules and process technology is desirable

          

Job Type:Student / Intern

Shift:Shift 1 (United States of America)

Primary Location: US, Oregon, Hillsboro

Additional Locations:US, Arizona, Phoenix, US, California, Santa Clara

Business group:As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art -- from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Employees in the Technology and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore's Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth

Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company's new website at:http://www.WabtecCorp.com.

It's not just about your career... or your job title...it's about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to go into uncharted waters...do things that haven't been done to make yours and someone else's life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Wabtec delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.

Role Summary:

Join our Digital Electronics Group Internship Program! Students with interests in Software Development, System Engineering, Quality Engineering, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Project Management can gain broad exposure to varied areas to Electronics, Network Optimization & Logistics, Train Performance & Automation, Signaling/Construction Business Groups. Our Summer Internship Program encourages college students to explore their professional interests while working on larger business projects. Our program goal is to bring your book learning to life, give you an opportunity to see what job opportunities are possible and prepare each student for a potential full -time position when they graduate in one of our challenging leadership programs or direct hire roles.

Experienced leaders mentor students and support their technical and professional development during internships. In addition to valuable work experience, students have the opportunity to build leadership and functional skills through management exposure, training, resume writing, presentation skills, communicating in the workplace, interviewing skills, and other selected topics.

Job Summary:

Support the design, development and testing of safety-critical server applications for Wabtec Railway Electronics (WRE), a leading supplier of technology-based products and services for the rail and transit industries.

Functions/Responsibilities:

  • Programming knowledge in the Linux and Microsoft Windows .NET environments, using C, C++, C#, and/or Java
  • Participate in coding, testing, debugging, configuring, and documenting software
  • Write code that is readable, maintainable, extensible, and correct
  • Work independently or with a team to develop solutions that meet project requirements within the program schedule and budget constraints
  • Make independent technical contributions in support of program objectives, as well as interacting with other Wabtec or contract software and systems engineers and customers
  • Facilitate support for fault isolation, troubleshooting, and root cause analysis activities during software integration and validation testing

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Must have completed at least one year of college (Rising Sophomore)
  • Must be enrolled in an accredited engineering degree program, OR be enrolled in an accredited technical Associates program
  • Must have and maintain at least a 3.0 cumulative GPA on a 4.0 scale after completing full year of college (or equivalent) no rounding

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Preference will be given to students pursuing the following degrees: Computer Science, Computer Engineer, Software Engineering, Electronics Engineering, System Engineering. Additional degrees may be considered including Technical Associates Degrees.
  • Experience in Programming languages, such as Microsoft Windows .NET environments, using C, C++, C#, Python, Java, JavaScript, etc.
  • Strong initiative with the ability to work independently and in teams
  • Technical aptitude, critical thinking and ability to problem solve
  • Strong communication & interpersonal skills
  • Able to work for a minimum of 12 weeks

Students local to the following location need only apply:

  • Germanton, MD

Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, for this role or for roles in the future. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation, drug screen and verification of transcript for GPA requirement. No relocation or housing offered for internship.

Wabtec Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or protected Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company's new website at:http://www.WabtecCorp.com.

It's not just about your career... or your job title...it's about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to go into uncharted waters...do things that haven't been done to make yours and someone else's life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Wabtec delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.

Role Summary:

Join our Digital Electronics Group Internship Program! Students with interests in Software Development, System Engineering, Quality Engineering, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Project Management can gain broad exposure to varied areas to Electronics, Network Optimization & Logistics, Train Performance & Automation, Signaling/Construction Business Groups. Our Summer Internship Program encourages college students to explore their professional interests while working on larger business projects. Our program goal is to bring your book learning to life, give you an opportunity to see what job opportunities are possible and prepare each student for a potential full -time position when they graduate in one of our challenging leadership programs or direct hire roles.

Experienced leaders mentor students and support their technical and professional development during internships. In addition to valuable work experience, students have the opportunity to build leadership and functional skills through management exposure, training, resume writing, presentation skills, communicating in the workplace, interviewing skills, and other selected topics.

Job Summary:

Support the design, development and testing of safety-critical server applications for Wabtec Railway Electronics (WRE), a leading supplier of technology-based products and services for the rail and transit industries.

Functions/Responsibilities:

  • Programming knowledge in the Linux and Microsoft Windows .NET environments, using C, C++, C#, and/or Java
  • Participate in coding, testing, debugging, configuring, and documenting software
  • Write code that is readable, maintainable, extensible, and correct
  • Work independently or with a team to develop solutions that meet project requirements within the program schedule and budget constraints
  • Make independent technical contributions in support of program objectives, as well as interacting with other Wabtec or contract software and systems engineers and customers
  • Facilitate support for fault isolation, troubleshooting, and root cause analysis activities during software integration and validation testing

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Must have completed at least one year of college (Rising Sophomore)
  • Must be enrolled in an accredited engineering degree program, OR be enrolled in an accredited technical Associates program
  • Must have and maintain at least a 3.0 cumulative GPA on a 4.0 scale after completing full year of college (or equivalent) no rounding

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Preference will be given to students pursuing the following degrees: Computer Science, Computer Engineer, Software Engineering, Electronics Engineering, System Engineering. Additional degrees may be considered including Technical Associates Degrees.
  • Experience in Programming languages, such as Microsoft Windows .NET environments, using C, C++, C#, Python, Java, JavaScript, etc.
  • Strong initiative with the ability to work independently and in teams
  • Technical aptitude, critical thinking and ability to problem solve
  • Strong communication & interpersonal skills
  • Able to work for a minimum of 12 weeks

Students local to the following location need only apply:

  • Germanton, MD

Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, for this role or for roles in the future. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation, drug screen and verification of transcript for GPA requirement. No relocation or housing offered for internship.

Do you want to join a team that helps people protect the things that matter the most to them? Are you interested in discovering how to apply the skills you’re learning in school to solve real-world challenges? Are you looking for a well-rounded experience that enables and encourages continuous learning and participation in corporate social responsibility initiatives?

This internship is designed for current students and soon to be college graduates to gain a well-rounded introduction to and experience in Information Technology.  The internship will focus on principles of Agile Application Development & Software Engineering and will equip you with transferrable skills that can help you anywhere you go.

The program is a paid internship where you will be engaged in immersive learning experiences, from Dojos to tech talks, with the opportunity to showcase your work with our leadership.

We offer flexible schedules and an immersive remote environment. We’ll also be on the look-out for individuals who might be a good fit to join us full-time after graduation. We’ll share more throughout the program.

What you’ll get to do:

  • Plan, Develop, Implement and/or Support applications in various languages and disciplines including:
    • C#
    • .NET
    • JavaScript
    • HTML
    • CSS
  • Creative problem solving
  • Object oriented programming
  • Learning new technologies in the web application space
  • Research, solve for, and engage others as necessary to develop solutions that will result in the desired business outcome 
  • Web/mobile development & integrated systems
  • Handle application development tasks from program flow design, coding, devops, testing, implementation rollout
  • Ability to work and think independently to produce working code
  • Work through and resolve production issues for applications supported by the department or functional area
  • Prepare documentation on work produced to ensure a smooth handoff to other developers, as needed 
     

You bring your experience, knowledge & skills:

  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn
  • Project or Teamwork
  • Presentations & Tech challenges
  • Creative problem solver
  • Ability to demonstrate logical thinking
  • Community Involvement

Education:

Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Development, Information Systems, or a related program at an accredited university.

Software Engineering Intern - Bothell, WA

 

Internships are a great way for university students to learn about a technology or product they are passionate about while gaining practical work experience in a corporate environment.  At Fujifilm Sonosite, we are committed to finding talented students who share our passion for medical device technology and this internship reflects that commitment!  We have the opportunity, you have the talent!  Read on to learn more about what we are looking for and if you think you’ve got what it takes to be successful in this role, apply today!  

 

FUJIFILM, Sonosite, Inc . We are an innovative and high performance culture with tremendous opportunities.  People who work here are given the unique opportunity to contribute to the advancement of healthcare throughout the world.  Headquartered in Bothell, WA USA, Fujifilm Sonosite is represented by a global distribution network in over 100 countries.  Since its inception, Fujifilm Sonosite’s lightweight, robust products have created and led the point-of-care ultrasound market. From sophisticated urban hospital emergency rooms to clinics in austere, remote villages, Fujifilm Sonosite systems are used by over 21 medical specialties and provide clinicians around the world with a cost-effective tool for improving patient safety and workflow efficiency. Fujifilm Sonosite holds a number of prestigious design awards and has in excess of 145 patents.


Job Summary:

 

The Software Engineering Intern will work as part of a focused, collaborative team of developers, designers, and clinical  engineers who will help them understand how to contribute to the development of ultrasound  technology. The SW Engineering intern will review and improve requirements for an ultrasound platform, prepare and execute tests for those requirements and have the opportunity to automate tests and fix straightforward defects.

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Follow established standards for software design methodologies, coding, and documentation. 
  • Review and improve software requirements 
  • Develop and execute tests for those requirements 
  • Prepare and review development artifacts 
  • Automate software tests 
  • Fix straightforward defects

Knowledge and Experience:

  • Pursuing a BS or MS degree in Computer Science or related discipline at an accredited institution 
  • Experience with Android applications development under Android Studio IDE desired 
  • Experience with Linux desired 
  • Experience with configuration management tools (e.g, Git) desired 
  • Programming experience in Java, C++, Python, and/or MATLAB desired 
  • Experience with REST API desired

Skills and Abilities:

  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both within other groups in Engineering and throughout the company.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, small team environment with minimal supervision.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to lift 25 pounds, with or without accommodations.

 

FUJIFILM Sonosite, Inc.  Visit us today to learn more about our exciting technologies and how you can make a difference.  To apply and obtain further details regarding key responsibilities and experience requirements, check out our careers page at   www.Sonosite.com/careers.

FUJIFILM Sonosite, Inc.   is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. 

In compliance with the ADA Amendments Act, should you have a disability that requires assistance and / or reasonable accommodation with the job application process, please contact the Human Resources department via phone at 425-951-1200, or via e-mail at ffss-hr@fujifilm.com .   Additionally, the affirmative program/plan is available for review upon formal request by employees and applicants for employment in the Human Resources office during regular office hours.

 

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

About CyberCube:

1) The market leader in digital analytics with the mission of delivering the world's leading cyber risk analytics on one of the most critical risks of today and the future.
2) Hypergrowth startup that has raised over $50mm in capital from top tier VCs.
3) Explosive team growth (from 15 employees in SF to 100+people globally and growing 50% more in 2021).
4) Explosive client base growth path having tripled our clients in 2020.
5) Phenomenal company culture where we are committed to enabling you to do the best work of your career. Check out our perfect score on Glassdoor!
6) An incredible high performing team of insurance industry professionals, data scientists, and engineers who love working here.
7) CyberCube and its products win industry awards every year (eg. CyberRisk Solution of the Year 2021).
8) Openness and accessibility of senior leadership including heads of Functions and CEO.

Role:
CyberCube is looking for students that are in their final year of bachelor's or Masters, this is an intern to full time hire position, based on the individual performance.
The Summer Internship program will run from June 1, 2021 through August 7, 2021.
This position is ideal for someone that wants to build and maintain end to end (from design requirements to development and testing) The ideal candidate is a self-starter that can be self-reliant when needed. You will be working in highly dynamic environment along with best minds in this domain.
Responsibilities
    • Application Development
    • Working with Front-End/ Back-End and Data Platforms
    • Unit testing of developed code
    • Automate and build modules for common functionality
Skills, And Abilities
    • Java, Python, SQL AWS
    • JavaScript, React, JS, HTML, CSS, OOPS and knowledge about CMS systems
Qualification/Education
    • Enrolled in an accredited College/University
Why You'll Love It Here
Play an instrumental role in reshaping one of the oldest industries in the world
Competitive salary and meaningful early stage equity

CyberCube Analytics, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We don't tolerate discrimination against age, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, race, color, nationality, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, protected genetic information or political affiliation.

Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world including Alipay, Stripe, Airbnb, and Microsoft leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern to be based out of Seattle, who thrives on designing, coding, and maintaining high performance data processing applications on the JVM platform (primarily in Clojure and Scala), running on AWS. 

Your ideal internship should be one where you work in a small team and are empowered to make yourself and your team more productive on a daily basis. You should want to be part of a team where your desire to grow and learn are valued and aptly rewarded; where using and contributing to open source are looked upon as an asset; where innovating and executing are core to your teams' beliefs.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will:

  • Write performant code and write automated test to validate correctness of code
  • Develop and deploy large-scale microservices and/or data processing systems
  • Meet development milestones and business requirements on schedule
  • Independently analyze, propose and develop solutions for technical problems and issues
  • Ensure the adherence to the standards and procedures that result in an environment compliant with information security policy

Our ideal Software Engineering Intern will have:

  • A willingness to learn new languages and techniques to solve challenging problems.
  • Experience in functional programming fundamentals.
  • BS degree in Computer Science, related degree or equivalent. Graduating before August 2022. 
  • Ability to write clean code that works, is readable, maintainable and follows best practices and coding standards
  • Understanding of OO and functional design, languages, algorithms and data structures
  • A philosophy of iteration and continuous improvement
  • A desire to own design and architecture end to end

Unwavering in our pursuit of standardizing global identity data, we are approachable, real people that genuinely care about the success of those we partner with. With a commitment to service, innovation, and ownership, Ekata is a dynamic place to work for folks who want to make an impact on a global scale. We provide learning & development opportunities for each employee and promote work-life flexibility through self-managed time off. Headquartered in downtown Seattle, Ekata is growing internationally with offices in Budapest, Hungary, Amsterdam, and in Singapore.

To learn more about the experience of working at Ekata visit: https://ekata.com/careers/

Ekata prides itself on celebrating diversity, inclusivity, and being an equal-opportunity employer.

#LI-TD

Mavenir is the industry's only end-to-end, cloud-native network software provider. Focused on accelerating software network transformation and redefining network economics for Communications Service Providers (CSPs) by offering a comprehensive end-to-end product portfolio across every layer of the network infrastructure stack. From 5G application/service layers to packet core and RAN - Mavenir leads the way in evolved, cloud-native networking solutions enabling innovative and secure experiences for end users. Leveraging industry-leading firsts in VoLTE, VoWiFi, Advanced Messaging (RCS), Multi-ID, vEPC, and Virtualized RAN, Mavenir accelerates network transformation for more than 250+ CSP customers in over 120 countries, serving over 50% of the world's subscribers.

Role Summary

Mavenir is seeking full-time Software Engineering Interns for the Summer 2021.

Relevant skills include Linux OS, IP networks, scripting languages, and preferably experience in telecom systems.

Key Responsibilities

  • Good knowledge of XML language and HTTP Protocol.

  • Optional experience with SIP, SMS and distributed database technology

  • Good understanding of Object Oriented Programming Concepts

  • Angular JS (Angular 4 preferred) would be a plus

  • Knowledge on Spring , Spring MVC, Spring Boot, Rest Template

  • Working experience on Linux/Unix with good shell scripting skills

  • Working knowledge of MySQL and other relational database

  • Hands on with Apache Tomcat or popular webserver

  • REST based Web services

Job Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a Computer Science or related degree program

  • Working experience with Linux (Redhat preferred) is mandatory.

  • cripting (in bash/Perl/Python) ability.

  • Working knowledge of SQL commands.

  • Familiarity with distributed databases like MySql, MariaDB, Cassandra, Swift.

  • Familiar with IP networking concepts (TCP, UDP, IP, VLAN, IP Subnet).

  • Familiar with Network Functions Virtualization (NFV) concepts, RedHat Openstack

  • Experience with technical standards including 3GPP, IETF, and ITU, telecom systems and tools.

Accessibility

If you are a US applicant in need of special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail careers@mavenir.com or call: +1-469-916-4393. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.
